verse.roman:
girayaḥ pratyadṛśyanta
nānāyudha-muco 'nagha
dig-vāsaso yātudhānyaḥ
śūlinyo mukta-mūrdhajāḥ

synonyms: girayaḥ—mountains; pratyadṛśyanta—appeared; nānā—various; āyudha—weapons; mucaḥ—discharging; anagha—O sinless Vidura; dik-vāsasaḥ—naked; yātudhānyaḥ—demonesses; śūlinyaḥ—armed with tridents; mukta—hanging loose; mūrdhajāḥ—hair.
translation: O sinless Vidura, mountains discharged weapons of various kinds, and naked demonesses armed with tridents appeared with their hair hanging loose.
